title.narrative: Provision of life-saving emergency food assistance to the most vulnerable newly displaced HHs in Salqin sub-district.

description.narrative: Compared to last year, the number of people in need in Syria for 2020 has increased by 8 percent. As of 2 February 2020 and according to the Food Security cluster’s report “Gap on Emergency Response”, the latest escalation of hostilities has resulted in around 586,000 people displaced mainly from southern Idleb and western Aleppo governorates, towards north-west Idleb and North Aleppo governorate. Those IDPs are considered to be severely food insecure and most of them are displaced multiple times and experiencing a deteriorating humanitarian situation and extreme poverty with lack of income making them unable to secure even their food for their children. This emergency response project is designed based on the gap in the emergency response to the newly displaced people and based on Sadad’s field reports and assessments of the latest needs of the newly displaced people in Salqin sub-district which is classified as the first prioritized area for emergency response according to FSS Gap on Emergency Response Report with more than 49451 IDPs of them about 22349 newly displaced accommodated in informal self-settled camps, collective centers, public buildings, unfinished houses, schools, etc. Throughout this project, Sadad will distribute 1600 food baskets monthly (78 kg. 2100 kcal/person/day for a family of 5) to the most vulnerable newly displaced HHs in 5 villages related to Salqin sub-district including informal self-settled camps (prioritizing female-headed households, women and young girls, HHs including pregnant, lactating women, elderly, disabled people or people with chronic illness and injuries, focusing also on unaccompanied and separated children). Sadad will target 8124 individuals every month for 3 months-period. The targeted IDPs have been displaced multiple times and considered severely food insecure. According to the recommendations of the FSL cluster, each food basket is 78 kg and contains about 2100 Kcal per person per day (for 5 people) to be distributed every month for 3 months-period. Each food basket contains a variety of food items based on the food security cluster recommendations and based on consultation with IDPs to cover all basic nutritional needs tailored to the Syrian culture and palette. Each Food Basket Contains: Wheat flour: 15 / Rice 14 kg / Macaroni 4 kg / vermicelli 2kg / Bulgur 10 kg / Beans 6 kg / Chickpeas 4 kg / Green lentils 4 kg / Red lentils 4 kg / Fish, tuna 1 kg / sunflower oil 5 lt / Margarine 1kg / sugar 6 kg / tomato paste 1.30 kg / salt (iodized) 1 kg. All components of this project will be implemented by Sadad contracted field staff under the direct supervision of Sadad management from the Turkey office in coordination with FSL Cluster through attending the cluster meetings, submitting 4W's, along with regular information and updates about the project activities and target locations.
